evidence.text:
Person A: William's mother, Augusta, passed away in `43- she got sick and died of a damned tooth infection of all things.
Person A: He's all right. He was too young then to remember much, and I was gone training two years in Arizona before they shipped us all off to Naples, Italy; 92nd Infantry Division. They wouldn't let me back home all that time, not once. Augusta's sister looked after him until I got back. Kept me alive though, knowing he was waiting for me.
Person A: Kept me good and alive, thank goodness.

Person B: Zsofia's mother passed.
Person B: Losing a mother- it's an unfathomable loss, you see. To lose one's birth mother is to lose the very foundation on which we stand.
Person B: The mind may not know its loss but the heart does.
